title: Show HN: 22 GB of Hacker News in SQLite
summary:
This "Show HN" post introduces "Hacker Book," a project that offers a 22 GB archive of Hacker News data in SQLite format. Envisioned as a community resource, "Hacker Book" aims to provide comprehensive access to Hacker News content from 2006, with an ambitious scope extending to 2025.

The accompanying text mimics the design and navigation of the official Hacker News website, featuring typical links such as "new," "front," "ask," and "show," suggesting it functions as an interface for exploring the dataset. Created by DOSAYGO, the project is framed with the slogan "Community, All the HN Belong to You!" and includes a clear call to action with a "[GET THIS]" link for users to acquire the archive.
chinese_title: HN 展示：SQLite 中的 22 GB Hacker News 数据
chinese_summary:
这个"Show HN"帖子介绍了“Hacker Book”项目，它提供了一个22 GB的Hacker News数据存档，采用SQLite格式。“Hacker Book”被设想为一个社区资源，旨在提供从2006年起Hacker News内容的全面访问，其宏伟目标是覆盖至2025年。

随附的页面模仿了官方Hacker News网站的设计和导航，包含“new”、“front”、“ask”和“show”等常见链接，这表明它作为一个探索数据集的界面。该项目由DOSAYGO创建，其标语是“社区，所有HN都属于你！”，并包含明确的行动号召，附带一个“[GET THIS]”链接供用户获取该存档。

title: Stranger Things creator says turn off “garbage” settings
summary:
"Stranger Things" creator Ross Duffer has issued a public service announcement, urging viewers to adjust their TV settings before watching the season 5 premiere. Duffer, in an Instagram guide, advised fans to turn off several features he labeled "garbage," including dynamic contrast, super resolution, edge enhancer, color filter, and noise reduction.

He specifically singled out truemotion and smoothmotion as the biggest "offenders" that cause the "dreaded soap opera effect." Duffer also strongly warned against using "vivid" mode, stating it "destroys the color" and fundamentally deviates from the filmmaker's artistic intent. While advanced viewing presets like Dolby Vision Movie Dark can help, he stressed that viewers should manually confirm these altering settings are disabled.

Duffer's advice highlights a conflict between technological advancements designed to appeal to casual viewers with sharper or more colorful images, and creators' goals to preserve their original vision. By turning off these features, viewers can ensure they experience "Stranger Things" exactly as the creators intended.

"Stranger Things" season 5, volume 1, is currently streaming on Netflix. Volume 2 is set to release on December 25, 2025, with the series finale on December 31, 2025.
chinese_title: 《怪奇物语》创作者：关掉“垃圾”设置
chinese_summary:
"Stranger Things" creator Ross Duffer has issued a public service announcement, urging viewers to adjust their TV settings before watching the season 5 premiere. Duffer, in an Instagram guide, advised fans to turn off several features he labeled "garbage," including dynamic contrast, super resolution, edge enhancer, color filter, and noise reduction.

He specifically singled out truemotion and smoothmotion as the biggest "offenders" that cause the "dreaded soap opera effect." Duffer also strongly warned against using "vivid" mode, stating it "destroys the color" and fundamentally deviates from the filmmaker's artistic intent. While advanced viewing presets like Dolby Vision Movie Dark can help, he stressed that viewers should manually confirm these altering settings are disabled.

Duffer's advice highlights a conflict between technological advancements designed to appeal to casual viewers with sharper or more colorful images, and creators' goals to preserve their original vision. By turning off these features, viewers can ensure they experience "Stranger Things" exactly as the creators intended.

"Stranger Things" season 5, volume 1, is currently streaming on Netflix. Volume 2 is set to release on December 25, 2025, with the series finale on December 31, 2025.

title: Stardew Valley developer made a $125k donation to the FOSS C# framework MonoGame
summary:
The developer behind Stardew Valley recently made a substantial $125,000 donation to MonoGame, a Free and Open Source Software (FOSS) C# framework. In an announcement dated December 30, 2025, the MonoGame Foundation outlined various ways for the community to support and engage with the project.

Financial contributions can be made through GitHub, PayPal, Patreon, or by purchasing merchandise from the MonoGame Store. Beyond monetary support, the foundation encourages community involvement through code contributions via Pull Requests, assisting in their Discord community, and writing blog posts. They also promote a bounty program, which allows contributors to get paid for fixing bugs and adding new features to the framework.
chinese_title: 星露谷物语开发者向开源C#框架MonoGame捐赠了12.5万美元。
chinese_summary:
《星露谷物语》的开发者最近向MonoGame（一个免费开源软件 (FOSS) 的C#框架）大笔捐赠了12.5万美元。在2025年12月30日发布的一份公告中，MonoGame基金会概述了社区支持和参与该项目的多种方式。

资金贡献可以通过GitHub、PayPal、Patreon进行，或者通过在MonoGame商店购买商品来实现。除了资金支持，基金会还鼓励社区通过Pull Request（拉取请求）贡献代码、协助其Discord社区以及撰写博客文章等方式参与。他们还推广了一项赏金计划，允许贡献者通过修复错误和为框架添加新功能来获得报酬。

title: Nicolas Guillou, French ICC judge sanctioned by the US and “debanked”
summary:
French International Criminal Court (ICC) judge Nicolas Guillou has been sanctioned by the United States under a decision made by Donald Trump on August 20. The US Treasury Department justified the action, stating that Guillou was designated for his role in authorizing the ICC's issuance of arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and former Minister of Defense Yoav Gallant. Both Israeli officials are indicted for war crimes and crimes against humanity for their roles in the destruction of the Gaza Strip.

Guillou is one of nine ICC personnel sanctioned by the US, a group that includes six judges and three prosecutors, notably Chief Prosecutor Karim Khan. In an interview with Le Monde, Guillou described the impact of these measures on his work and daily life and called on European authorities to activate a mechanism to limit the effects of US restrictions. The US sanctions mechanism, initially designed for human rights violations, counter-terrorism, and drug trafficking, now lists nearly 15,000 individuals, predominantly members of terrorist groups, mafia organizations, and authoritarian regimes, with ICC judges recently added to this extensive list.
chinese_title: 尼古拉·吉洛，法国国际刑事法院法官，被美国制裁并被银行断供
chinese_summary:
法国国际刑事法院 (ICC) 法官尼古拉·吉约已根据唐纳德·特朗普8月20日作出的一项决定，受到美国制裁。美国财政部为此行动辩护，指出吉约受到制裁是因为他授权国际刑事法院对以色列总理本雅明·内塔尼亚胡和前国防部长约阿夫·加兰特发出逮捕令。这两名以色列官员都因在加沙地带的破坏行动中扮演的角色而被控犯有战争罪和危害人类罪。

吉约是受到美国制裁的九名国际刑事法院人员之一，这批人员包括六名法官和三名检察官，其中最著名的是首席检察官卡里姆·汗。在接受《世界报》采访时，吉约描述了这些措施对其工作和日常生活的影响，并呼吁欧洲当局启动一项机制，以限制美国制裁的影响。美国的制裁机制最初旨在打击侵犯人权、反恐和贩毒行为，目前已列入近15,000名个人，其中绝大多数是恐怖组织成员、黑手党组织和专制政权成员，而国际刑事法院的法官们最近也被添加到这份庞大的名单中。

title: The future of software development is software developers
summary:
A 43-year veteran programmer, the author dismisses the notion that Large Language Models (LLMs) will replace software developers, viewing it as the latest iteration in a long cycle of similar, failed predictions. He recounts previous technologies—from WYSIWYG editors and 4GLs to No-Code platforms—that were similarly touted as the "end of programmers," yet consistently resulted in more programs and more developers, illustrating Jevons Paradox.

While acknowledging the unprecedented scale of current "AI" hype, the author argues that LLMs often hinder development, making software less reliable and maintainable, unlike previous genuinely productive tools. The fundamental challenge of programming, he explains, isn't syntax but transforming ambiguous human thought into precise, unambiguous computational logic—a task requiring general intelligence that LLMs, with their syntactic models, fundamentally lack. He emphasizes that LLM-generated code is inconsistent, prone to errors, and demands human expertise for recognition and correction.

Skeptical about the long-term viability of expensive hyper-scale LLMs, he likens them to unsustainable "Apollo Moon missions." The author foresees a future where modest "AI" assistants might aid with prototypes or minor tasks, but human software developers will remain indispensable at the helm, likely in greater numbers. He advises employers to hire developers now, predicting a resurgence in demand once the current "fever dream" of AI replacing programmers dissipates.
chinese_title: 软件开发的未来在于软件开发者
chinese_summary:
拥有43年经验的资深程序员兼本文作者驳斥了大型语言模型（LLMs）将取代软件开发人员的观点，认为这只是漫长且失败的同类预测循环中的最新一环。他回顾了从所见即所得编辑器、第四代编程语言（4GLs）到无代码平台等之前的技术，它们曾被同样吹捧为“程序员的终结”，但结果却始终是带来了更多的程序和更多的开发人员，这恰好印证了杰文斯悖论。

尽管作者承认当前“AI”炒作的规模前所未有，但他认为，与之前真正提高生产力的工具不同，LLMs往往阻碍开发，使软件变得更不可靠、更难以维护。他解释说，编程的根本挑战不在于语法，而在于将模糊的人类思维转化为精确、无歧义的计算逻辑——这项任务需要通用智能，而LLMs凭借其句法模型根本不具备这种能力。他强调，LLM生成的代码前后不一致，容易出错，需要人类专业知识来识别和纠正。

他对昂贵的超大规模LLMs的长期可行性持怀疑态度，将它们比作不可持续的“阿波罗登月任务”。作者预见未来，适度的“AI”助手或许能协助原型开发或次要任务，但人类软件开发人员仍将不可或缺地掌控全局，甚至数量可能还会增加。他建议雇主现在就招聘开发人员，预测一旦当前AI取代程序员的“狂热梦想”消散，对开发人员的需求将重新激增。
